sense.gloss: to twist, to wrench, to turn (a switch on or off, etc.), to wring (a neck)
to get twisted, to get crooked, to get warped
to become twisted (of a mind, relationship, etc.), to become warped, to become perverse, to become contrary
to become troubled, to become complicated, to become strained
to distort, to parody, to make a pun
managing (to raise funds, find time, etc.), contriving, scraping together (money)
working out (a plan, solution, etc.), thinking out, devising, contriving
key (of a clock, watch, etc.), spring
to fiddle around with, to play with, to rewrite
to work out, to think up, to devise, to come up with
to manage to find (money, time, etc.), to scrape together (funds)
to pinch and crush, to pinch out
to be contrary, to be uncooperative, to be rebellious
to thrust into, to push into, to shove into, to squeeze in (e.g. a meeting)
to protest (and seek rectification), to complain
to hold down, to twist someone's arm
to force (someone) to yield (e.g. an argument), to make (someone) surrender
to fiddle with, to change (e.g. wording)
to become twisted, to grow distorted, to be curved, to bend
to grow bitter, to become embittered, to become perverse
turning an object in the wrong direction

sdata.j: ↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓みはずして↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓したようです。
sdata.e: I missed a step on the stairs and I'm afraid I sprained my ankle.

sdata.j: そんな↑事↑↓こと↓は、↑彼↑↓かれ↓にとっては↑赤子↑↓あかご↓の↑手↑↓て↓を↑捻↑↓ねじ↓るようなものだ。
sdata.e: For him, that will be like taking candy from a baby.

sdata.j: この↑程度↑↓ていど↓の↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓なら、１↑週間↑↓しゅうかん↓↑程↑↓ほど↓で↑治↑↓なお↓るでしょう。
sdata.e: A sprain like this should heal within a week or so.

sdata.j: あんな↑底↑↓そこ↓の↑厚↑↓あつ↓いサンダル↑履↑↓は↓いてたら、↑転↑↓ころ↓んで↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓しちゃうぞ。
sdata.e: You're going to fall and sprain your ankle wearing sandals with such huge platforms.

sdata.j: あんなにかかとの↑高↑↓たか↓い↑靴↑↓くつ↓はいてたら、すぐに↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓しちゃうよな。
sdata.e: If I tried to wear shoes with heels that high, I'd sprain my ankle.

sdata.j: ↑赤木↑↓あかぎ↓キャプテンは↑練習↑↓れんしゅう↓↑中↑↓ちゅう↓に↑足↑↓あし↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓したので、↑試合↑↓しあい↓↑前↑↓まえ↓にテーピングでガチガチに↑固↑↓かた↓めた。
sdata.e: Akagi sprained an ankle during practice so before the game he taped it up until it was stiff as a board.

sdata.j: ↑戦費↑↓せんぴ↓の↑捻出↑↓ねんしゅつ↓に↑国債↑↓こくさい↓が↑発行↑↓はっこう↓された。
sdata.e: Bonds were issued to finance a war.

sdata.j: ↑二↑↓に↓↑人↑↓にん↓はローンの↑頭金↑↓あたまきん↓を↑捻出↑↓ねんしゅつ↓できなかった。
sdata.e: The couple wasn't able to produce the down payment for the loan.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑転↑↓ころ↓んで↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓した。
sdata.e: He fell, twisting his ankle.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓をやり↑込↑↓こ↓めるくらい、↑赤子↑↓あかご↓の↑手↑↓て↓を↑捻↑↓ねじ↓るより↑簡単↑↓かんたん↓だよ。
sdata.e: Cornering him in an argument is easy—like taking candy from a baby.

sdata.j: ↑予算↑↓よさん↓はなんとしても↑捻出↑↓ねんしゅつ↓しなければなりません、↑議長↑↓ぎちょう↓。↑子供↑↓こども↓たちのためです。
sdata.e: We must find the money, Madam Chairman, for the sake of the children.

sdata.j: アルバイトをすることで、↑学生↑↓がくせい↓は↑自力↑↓じりき↓で↑学費↑↓がくひ↓を↑捻出↑↓ねんしゅつ↓することが↑可能↑↓かのう↓になります。
sdata.e: Students, by working part time, are able to scrape up tuition fees by themselves.

sdata.j: ↑批判↑↓ひはん↓するだけなら↑概↑↓がい↓して↑簡単↑↓かんたん↓だろうが↑代替↑↓だいたい↓↑案↑↓あん↓を↑捻出↑↓ねんしゅつ↓するのは↑難↑↓むずか↓しい。
sdata.e: As a general rule, it's simple to criticize, but difficult to produce alternative suggestions.

sdata.j: いくら↑頭↑↓あたま↓を↑捻↑↓ねじ↓ろうがそんな↑名前↑↓なまえ↓は↑出↑↓で↓てこなかった。
sdata.e: No matter how I racked my brain, I couldn't remember that name.

sdata.j: 「ふむ」 ↑武田↑↓たけだ↓↑先生↑↓せんせい↓は↑口↑↓くち↓ひげを↑捻↑↓ねじ↓りながらうなった。
sdata.e: Hrmm, mumbled Professor Takeda as he twisted his moustache.

sdata.j: ↑体↑↓からだ↓を↑捻↑↓ねじ↓ってから↑下↑↓した↓までしゃがみます。
sdata.e: After twisting your body, squat down.

sdata.j: どうやって↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓したの？
sdata.e: How did you sprain your ankle?

sdata.j: ↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓しちゃったんだ。
sdata.e: I’ve got a sprained ankle.

sdata.j: ↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓しちゃったんだ。
sdata.e: I've sprained my ankle.

sdata.j: ↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓しちゃったんだ。
sdata.e: I twisted my ankle.

sdata.j: ↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓しちゃったんだ。
sdata.e: I sprained my ankle.
